text: 2013 Bottle at lambiczoom, Milano, 2nd May 17. Pours copper in colour, no head. Aroma is dates, fig, dark fruit, barrel and booze. Taste is caramel, dates, soaked fruit, liquor, barrel, soaked wood. Rich, slick palate. Fantastic barley wine, not too sweet, way out there.

Bottle sample at Lambiczoon, vintage 2013. Dark brown pour. Aroma of raisin, caramel, booze, fudge, red fruit and vanilla. Rich flavor of raisin, caramel, dates, vanilla, red fruit, vanilla and a boozy fruity finish. Every drop is an explosion of flavors. Tastes like a marriage between moscatel and a barley wine. Really delicious.

2013
Wygląd: ciemny bursztyn, piany brak
Aromat: suszone i kandyzowane owoce, figi, daktyle, rodzynki, jest slodko
Smak: słodko, pełne, wyklejajace, gęste, likierowate, znów suszone i kandyzowane owoce, rodzynki, karmel, miod pitny

Bottle vintage 2011. Pours a murky brown. 
Aroma is sweet with added honey and very malty with a bit of alcohol spice. Flavor is very much the same. Mouth feel is heavy body and smooth. Great beer!? (is this still a beer?:))

Bottle, dark amber color no foam. The nose reminds a passito wine, malvasia sweet wine. Wood is there along with dried fruit. Mouth is sweet and charming, elegant hints of caramel and vanilla extract.

750ml bottle @Pułapka, Gdańsk
Honey, raisins and malty caramel. Great aroma. Taste is sweet mead and fruitiness, nicely thick and oily. Very round and vanilla finish
Bottle, 2013. Malty, lots of dried fruits, molasses, caramel. In taste sweet, fruity with caramel and light sugary note. Full body, no carbonation, smooth. Finish bit alcoholic, quite dry.

W ogóle bez gazu, ciemnobrązowe. W zapachu rodzynki, banany, słodkie, mocno utlenione. Smak bardzo likierowy, słodki, cukierkowy. Alkohol w bardzo przyjemny sposób grzeje w przełyk, ale w smaku nie ma go praktycznie w ogóle. Piwo likierowe, wybitnie degustacyjne, znakomite.
Sweet, liquor aroma, notes of raisins and bananas. no carbonation. Nice alcohol in the throat. WUNERBAR.

Lots of honey in nose, followed by caramel, vanilla, dried fruits. Pours mahogany without head. Taste is sweet with honey, toffee, vanilla, dried fruits, marzipan. Low bitter finish, completely flat carbonation, oily texture. Overall wonderful.
Aromat mleczny, krówkowy. W smaku toffi, mleczne krówki oblane ciemną czekoladą. Przepiękne piwo.
Brownish, absolutely no head. Aroma: malt, barrell, dry fruits. Lots of sweetness, honey, oxidation, barrell. Absolutely perfectly hidden alcohol.

500 ml bottle from Systembolaget, vintage 2013. Murky chestnut brown, hints of ruby. No head, no lacing. Great sweet port nose, sweet with sticky dried fruits, raisins and figs are prominent, earthy and caramel sweetness. Full-bodied, non-existent carbonation, sweet and viscous mouthfeel. Sweet complex taste, Madeira / Port / Sherry guessing youll find everything from it, figs, raisins, honey, malt syrup, vanilla, leaves, earthy, oak barrels and hints of tobacco. There are lots of flavor to find here, very sweet and takes its time to drink. If you appreciate vintage port, you will love this! Long warming finish.

Pite w ramach panelu w Carpe Kraft. Nalewa się bez piany co w niczym nie przeszkadza. Barwa ciemno rubinowa, klarowna. W aromacie duża dawka słodyczy, szlachetnego alkoholu, kandyzowanych fig, daktyli, rodzynek. Odczucie w ustach niesamowite, zupełnie niekojarzące się z piwem. Gęste, wyklejające, bliżej mu do miodu niż piwa. Pije się z olbrzymią satysfakcją.

Rocznik 2012? O ile pamiętam. Cóż mówić piwo bez piany piękny kolor, słodziutkie przypomina gęstszy półtorak. :D Brakowało akcentów beczkowych w tej wersji ale tak wiem jest to piwo bez beczki w każdym razie wydaje sie idealne do barrel age.
2011 bottle. Dark reddish brown shade. Big aroma with raisins and golden syrup. Hints of smoke and chocolate. Sweet but with a dry edge. A pleasure to drink.

80cl from bottle at Open Baladin Torino.Rich, noble aroma. Raisins, figs, vanilla, marzipan. Little alcohol.
The taste is full, sweet tons of dried fruits, vanilla liqueur. Masterpiece.

Feel 75cl bottle at Baladin Bologna, Italy. Pours brown, no foam looking very much like whisky. Beautiful yellow reflections on the edge, and deep brown when observed from beneath. Aroma is rich: malty of course, caramel, licorice and honey very well recognizable, nuts, toffee. Body is dense but not as much as I would have expected. No carbonation. Quite some tickling of the nose. Taste starts with sweetness, which gradually gives way to a nice bitterness, and a deep alcoholic feeling. Finish is relatively long, not as much as I would have expected. No astringency, again against my expectations.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 (bottle 14%abv 2013 edition)
Aroma:red wine,marzipan,caramel,brown sugar,slighlty boozy but in good way.

Taste:veery sweet,flavour of caramel,honey,brown sugar,some dried fruits (mainly prunes) and fudge.
Palate:full body,syrup-like moutfeel,no carbonation.
Overall:Lovely sweet monster ,wish aroma was a bit more intensive.

Unclear mahogany color, no head. Flat. Vinous aromas with raisins, figs, dates, liqueur, fruit flavored candy, brandy, vanilla and alcohol. Very sweet taste of dired fruits, vinous, liqueur, alcohol, wood and syrup. Too much alcohol during the taste/finish. Very much on the sweet side.

Bez piany a struktura bardzo gęsta powoli spływa po ściankach

Podsumowując no pewnie ze smaczne, bardzo złożone i skierowane raczej do #teamcukrzyca, mi to raczej przypomina coś w stylu miodu pitnego czy jerez/sherry. Ale na tle piw to raczej ok to musi być drogie i dobre jest omom

Aroma with a lot of caramel, alcohol (rum and cognac), fruits into alcohol, some raisins, wood bark and cinnamon. A very sweet and caramelized taste, with syrup of brown sugar slightly burnt and very concentrated, well alcoholized (rum and cognac), sweetened exotic fruits. Wonderful!

Mennyei aromái szinte leírhatatlanok, ezerféle színben játszanak, leginkább azonban a likőrökben ázó aszalványok koordináta-rendszerében képzelhetőek el. Vanília, karamellizált cukor, portói, édeskés faháncs, dió, mazsola csemegeszerű karaktere illatában, rumos, karamellás, desszertboros, likőrös jegyek selymes, olajos kavalkádja ízében. Intenzitása a rövid italokéval vetekszik, komplexitása, desszertszerű jellege ellenére is zseniálisan rétegzett, elegáns vonalai mégis egy kimagasló értékkel bíró barley wine képét festik meg.

Bottle from Elysium. Aroma: Dried fruit, light alcohol, caramel. Appearance: Dark ruby body, no head. Taste: Great composition of dried dates and apricots covered in caramel, liquour alcohol, very sweet, vert pleasant. Palate: Sweet finish, high body, no carbonation.

Bottled:Pours dark reddish brown, no head or carbonation. Sweet aroma with notes of fudge, caramel, oak casks and a little bit of blue cheese. Sweet and thick mouthfeel. Sweet taste with notes of fudge, marshmallows, oak casks and some licorice. Warming finish.

Bottle @Cimeria, Oviedo. 29-12-2016.
"Cata improvisada". Botella de Julius. Gracies!
"Reserva Teo Musso 2011".
Amazingly rich and complex barley wine. Lots os toffee, sweet, vanilla, licorice, dired fruit aromas and flavours. Really viscous texture, silky. Lovely, cloying...one of those "resembling spirit" beers.

Really sweet, with the alcohol drying out the sweetness, with a good deal of sherry oxidation notes and brandy infused dried fruit. Excellent.

Pours unclear dark amber. No head. Smell is intense , walnut. Bit booze. Taste is very very silky, walnut, oak, intense, sweet. Very Rich, complex, some raisins. Very Nice !

Sample. Amber no head. Malt, tobacco, ripe fruits, oak aroma. Strong sweet ripe fruits flavour, sherry, caramel, oily texture

May 16. A 0.5 l bottle, 2012 vintage. It poured hazy, only lightly carbonated copper-brown body with no head. Very strong malty aroma of figs, sugar, brandy, caramel, cooked fruit, leather, alcohol...everything. Brandy-like. Flavor was sweet but not as much as aroma would indicate. Quite complex although a tad less than in nose, very fruity, both dried and cooked fruit, especially raisins, sugar, caramel, a bit of wood and leather. Alcohol of course. Full body, cloying, with a sticky mouthfeel. Very long, warming, but pleasant, although very sweet finish. Hard to elaborate anyway, but interesting and unique experience. As it got warmer and opened up completely, showed elegant orange peel bitterness, especially in the finish. Probably it would be even better, more complex after a couple of years. Extremely slowly going and cloying, would be hard for a normal person to finish this single bottle in an evening all alone.

Fin vinröd färg helt utan skum, stor doft med tydliga toner av russin, plommon och bränt socker. Vinös smak helt utan kolsyra som exploderar i eftersmaken med ljuva toner av port, sherry, mogna bär, bränt socker med mera.

March 23, 2016. Bottle, vintage 2012. 
Clear amber with no head. Aroma is figs, raisins, caramel, some sherry, port notes, light earthy notes, warming alcohol. Taste is sweet very sweet with dried fruits, prunes, figs, raisins, very light bitter, slightly earthy and warming sherry alcohol in the finish. Thick oily texture, no carbonation.

Bottle; pours dark amber with no head; boozy aroma with dark fruits, honey, and hints of caramel and wood; tastes like a port, sweet with dark fruits, caramel, honey, and a hint of wood, finish is sweet with alcohol warming; very good - almost a dessert beer
sample from bottle, deep darker amber colour, nose of bitter cacao, raisins, whisky, caramel fugde, and dark fruits, plums, lots of sweet dried fruits, wine grapes, creamy mouthfeel. nice stuff.

Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours hazy reddish chestnut brown with no head worth mentioning. Smell is malty and fruity with caramel, toffee, dark dried fruits, pears, caramelised apples, sherry, madeira, leather, moist soil and sherry alcohol. Taste is sweet, slightly bitter, malty and fruity. Mouthfeel is round, viscous, oily, slightly boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and slightly bitter with caramel, toffee, sweet dark bread, English Christmas fruit cake, dried cherries, prunes, dates, raisins, moist soil, leather, minerals and sherry alcohol. For being competent flat its extremely fat and oily in the mouthfeel. Immense barley wine with amazing flavour. Lovely!!!

As Baladin Xyauyu Riserva Teo Musso Birra Da Divano Vintage 2012 14.0%ABV

Clear oily and deep nutty color with almost no head. Good intensity in the aroma. Full body and a soft to flat carbonation. Oily texture. Very complex beer. Dried fruits, toffee, oak, vanilla, vinous and very well masked alcohol. Tasty nice evening sipper.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]
Zwart bier zonder schuim. Geur : oxidatie, maderisatie, cacao. Smaak: alcoholisch, zoet, chocolade, rozijnen. Zoete afdronk.

Bottle @ Baladin Bistrot, Milan. Pours very dark brown, no head. Aroma of rich malt, wood, rather sweet, dark fruits, dates, plum, sweet dessert wine, madaria, some alcohol, light oxidation. Flavor is sweet, rich malty, alcohol, dessert wine, lots of dark fruit, dates, plum, riasin, some aloohol. Full body, flat carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. The rather high ABV is clearly there, but is well controlled by the sweetness. Nice and complex barley wine. 101215
Swietny aromat, klarowne, brak lekkiej kontry do slodyczy, alkohol wogole nie wyczuwalny w smaku delikatnie rozgrzewa.

Looks.. Mahogany red, Brown amber tinge, no head.
Smells..sweet barley wine caramel and malts and loads of sweet dark plums and prunes..some oak too.
Tastes.. Like a fortified wine x barley wine, sweet boozy red fruits and dry fruit sweetness, a thick cough medicinal mouth feel, some hints of that 14.5% that warm the belly. This could be shared in port glasses of consumed in gluttony. Its like no other beer style Ive tried before.. Very fortified wine-esque.

Color caoba claro, aroma malta, sabor pasas dulce, cuerpo denso.

Flavor is sweet, rich, malty, hints of Graham cracker, boatloads of dried fruit, marshmallow. Very reminiscent of hair of the dog. Full creamy mouthfeel. Some heat.

Dirty brown, no head. Aroma has raisins, chocolate and alcohol. Flavour has chocolate and lots of dried fruits. Very rich and smooth. Earlier Rating: 7/24/2013 Total Score: 4.2BBE: End of the world. Dirty brown body, no head. Aroma has bread, nuts, caramel, raisins and alcohol. Flavour has lots of chocolate, raisins and huge alcohol. This is quite strange, but really nice. Oily and really velvety mouthfeel. Liquid chocolate. Some sweet tar rices when finishing and warms. Really huge beer. Finishes sweet and lasts really long.

Dried fruits, Madeira and sweetness. Very enjoyable indeed. Earlier Rating: 7/24/2013 Total Score: 4.3250 ml bottle. BB end of the world. No # visible. From Italy. Courtesy of Brandman. 
Dirty murky brown colour with no head. 
Strong alcohol, malt and some bitterness in the aroma. 
The flavour is quite incredible. Its chocolate, berries, malt... 
Its more like a liqueur than a beer. Extremely smooth. As fridge cold it feels like its room temperatured. Warming. But the flavour of the alcohol is super well hidden. Balanced. This is an experience. Time and money well spend. My goodness this is good.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 50cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours a rich, oily dark amber to garnet colour with no carbonation. Aroma is powerful vanilla, dried fruits, honeyed fruits and sweetness with a clearly high alcohol content. Taste is upfront toffee, with roasted almonds, a fleeting hint of coffee, chocolate, caramelized cashew nuts and very rich Christmas cake. Almost tastes bourbon barrel aged with the level of buttery vanilla richness evident in both the aroma and taste. The only slight criticism (other than the expected lack of carbonation) is the level of sweetness - It needs an extra profile to detract from the sweetness which I think that the barrel aged versions (tobacco?) would achieve with the addition of an earthy or peatiness which I would expect to achieve a more harmonious balance. The closest competitor to this I have tried is Samichlaus which is a simple malt bomb in comparison and a 1986 Thomas Hardy which was too oxidised and a little to heavy on the Madeira as a result. All in all this is a fantastic experience beer and I will look to seek out the other versions.

Draught at Open Baladin Rome. Vintage 2012. Golden brown color, no head. Caramel nose, raisins, anise, hint of alcohol and wood. Caramel taste, heavy sweet, wood, rich malty, dried fruit. Full body, flat carbonation, oily texture.
Espectacular cervesa envellida fins la perfecció. Aromes bonissims molt llaminers i còrpora increible, sembla cognac però sense notar tant lalcohol que està molt ben integrat. Brutal!

100 ml from bottle at Baladin Bologna. Dark copper, quite clear, no head at all. Lots of alchool legs, though. Boozy and slightly harsh nose, but Im not a huge fan of certain aromas. Dark fruits, burnt caramel, molasses and some baked apples reminiscence. Completely different, in a great way, taste wise. Thick and sirupy without being cloying at all. Rich and addicting malt sweetness, lovely fruity edge, ridicolous drinkability considering the ABV. Flat carbonation, medium to full body, oily texture. Probably a 4.5+ beer if I were a fan of boozy beers. Still superb!

Sampled from bottle at Craft Bier Fest Wien Tasting Sessions.
Dark copper, brownish body, without head.
Liqueur like aroma of dried fruits, cognac, dark berries, caramel.
Taste is also very liqueur like, sweet and sticky, with booze, dried fruits, berries, caramel, chocolate, cognac.
Full, very oily mouthfeel, without any carbonation.

Tasty. Although this is really sweet and sticky, its so well balance that it never gets uncomfortable. I propably couldnt tell this is a beer if I didnt know it. Completely unique stuff. Still not my favourite from the Xyauyù range.

Bottled. Pours clear mahagony with a tiny head. Aroma of caramel, dark fruits, wood, vanilla and tobacco notes. Sweet flavor that ends up slightly bitter with an alcohol bite. Full bodied oily to syrupy texture and flat carbonation. A great Barley. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottle at the Charlottesville Tasting shared by jackl, thanks! Hazy amber with off-white head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, honey, dark fruit. Tastes of caramel, dark fruit, maple, apples. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Apricot, almond, and cashew. Cloudy copper, thin head. Cranberry, apricot, and cashew, muddled and intense. Medium body,easy carbonation.

Bottle @ The Baby Leopard Tasting. Slightly hazy deep amber with a small head. Nose of spritzy mandarin orange, plum and peach. Cherry skin and banana bread. Taste of apple crisp. Honey. Trail mix. Hot, sweet, fun.
Bottle courtesy of jackl, thanks! Hazy deep amber color, almost flat. Aroma of butterscotch. Taste is hot sweet butterscotch. Tasty.

Flavour of rich sweet maltiness, bread, red berries, red wine, green apples and wooden tartness. Full bodied. Very rich. A dessert. Elegant.

Awesome but I'd like to compare it to something with a little less age on it.

A - The most sherry / port looking beer. Lots of mahogany and blood red. Totally still, great clarity but no head / bubbles at all. 

S - Nose is really awesome. It has that super insane caramelized sugar due to that very long boil. Tobacco, bay leaves, hearty fruit cake. 

T - This is incredibly sweet but not overpowering or like I cant finish a glass but in this maple syrup drizzled on biscotti with capers and dried figs put into a blender with a dash of vanilla, cocoa and horse antlers. wow.

M - Very thin, very slick, oily and the booze is not overpowering, nor do oak tannins totally overwhelm. 

O - Its great that its flat, its oily. The touch of child tears and zebra snot really pull it together. Lets keep this up, babies.

Cervesa molt complexa tant en aroma com en gust, hi ha una barreja entre fruites vermelles, tocs torrats i a fusta.
Cerveza muy compleja tanto en aroma como en sabor, hay una mezcla entre frutos rojos, toques tostados y a madera.

Bottle sampled at Open Baladin, Rome. Pours, hazy brown with no head. Aroma of molasses, caramel, overripe dark fruit, oak, fudge and vanilla. Flavor is heavy sweet but in no way cloying. Lingering fudge in the palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation. Excellent!

Bottled @ Open Baladin, Roma. September 2013. Dark copper beer, no head to mention. Very malty aroma has fruits, mainly plums and raisins. Some alcohol too. Flavour is pretty much the same with some chocolaty and caramel/toffee notes. Very nice!

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Riserva 2009; abv 14%. Limpido color ambrato-ramato completamente privo di schiuma. Aroma avvolgente e penetrante con sentori di toffee, frutta sciroppata, canditi, albicocche secche e uvetta sotto spirito; gusto dolciastro, rotondo, morbido, liquoroso, fruttato, caramellato e con un finale vinoso e leggermente alcolico e "caldo" che ricorda molto un passito, accompagnato da più deboli note di frutta secca. Priva di effervescenza e vellutata come non mai al palato: morbida e persistente sulla lingua anche dopo lungo tempo. Eccezionale.

2014-07-08. Dark amber brown body headless. Aroma is rich and sweet malt, dark fruit. 7++ Flavour is similarly sweet, richly malty. Smooth medium bodied palate, no carbonation, syrupy. Lovely, deserving of more detailed notes than I gave it unfortunately. Bottle, Tasting at cgarvieuks, Edinburgh
2009 Bottle thanks to Gibson. Pours a clear copper with no head. The aroma is strong caramel, dark fruit, figs. Thin mouthfeel with strong dark fruit, figs, oak, strong booze.

[Bottle at Mondial 2014, Montreal] Pours an oily-looking dark brown with no head. Aroma: Wow! Soy sauce, chocolate, wood, red wine, dark fruit, hops, molasses and so much more -- complex and awesome. Flavour is also "wow", with soy sauce, maple syrup and all the aforementioned stuff. Alcohols there but pretty well hidden considering the abv. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied. Amazing.

Riserva 2004 Teo Musso 13% abv  .... Cloudy amber pour with no carbonation and no head .... Aroma of sweet fruits, caramel malts, almost wine like and dark fruits with almonds and a slight abv in there too .. Has a lingering sweetness and an overall syrupy feel to it think port wine ... 10 years old and tasty but nothing crazy here. Like a sweet wine
UPDATED: APR 30, 2014 Is is more like wine than beer. Not carbonated. Interesting to taste once, but too expensive

text: Bottle @ van moll tasting. Brown color and no head. Smells and tastes sweet, sirup, cherry, no carbo.

Taste is very sweet, sweet malts, sweet raisins, alcohol, wood, liquor. Sticky, syrupy texture, medium to full body and carbonation. Wow, heavy beer.
Bottle @ proeftafel Van Moll. Amber colour no head. Smells molasses, sweet, syrup, apple, cider. Tastes sweet, molasses, syrup, very sweet, raisins. Medium body, soft carbo. Very sweet.
Pours an dark orange beer with a small white head. Smells molasses, very sweet. Tastes very sweet. Syrup, molasses. Way too sweet. Low carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

2009 vintage released in 2013. Deep ruby color flat carbonation. Aroma is big alcohol with port wine, oak barrel and thick syrupy dark fruit.
Flavor is crazy. The depth of flavor is unreal. Honey, sherry, fruity esters of raisin, dates and figs. Light hints of barley and the oxidized just long enough. I like my barely wine at least 2 years old, maybe I need to hold them longer because this is insanely smooth. Yet not many breweries hold their barley wine in oak for two years. Full body with a sweet character without being cloying. This is way beyond anything I that Ive had in the style. This is 14 % and I dont taste any alcohol, unreal!

Med ölföreningen julen 2013. Smak och doft romrussin, kontaktlim, likör, vanilj, madeira, fatkaraktär och marsipan. Oljig, rund, len men alldeles för sötsliskig vilket drar ner den intensiva smakupplevelsen.

Draft at Eataly. Part of a flight. Red brown color. Carmel color. Carmel taste. Has an offensive smell like rotten plums. Taste was surprisingly good. Carmel candy sweet warm. Enjoyable but not too much of it please.

How: Bottle.
Where: From Systembolaget, had at home.

Bottle shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours clear pale brown with no head. Nose is huge dark fruit, raisin, plum, swirling mix of aromas and a touch of heat. Smells amazing! Pours a deep sienna dull golden color with a trace of gaseous bubbles rising. The nose is full of heavy oxidized notes, old paper, sea salt caramel, leather, smoked cheesecloth, fig. The palate follows with a long silky flavor that matches the nose nicely but progresses with delicate balance. Rich sweet yet elegant. Boozy dates stuffed with buttery paper and drizzled with sea salt caramel sauce... touch of umami quality late in the flavor draws out a slow lingering finish.

Beer tasted after dinner and much anticipated. It been quite disappointing as too sweet, oily and with the feeling of drinking a syrup. Sherry and dried fruit together with lots of vanilla, thick mouthfeel and a sweet short aftertaste, you can feel the booze but its very mild. An amazing and unique experience. Year 2009

Labeled 2009 Riserva Teo Musso. Aroma acetone, whiskey, tobacco and ash. Taste unexpectedly sweet. At odd times dark fruits, grapes, caramel. tobacco, leather, ash wander in and out of the flavor. Very unique. Sometimes seems like a big mess, other times its brilliant.

En 2009-flaska från SB drucken på julölsprovningen 2013. Otroligt koncentrerade söta dofter och smaker. Sött dessertvin, madeira, russin, vanilj, lite klister, torkad frukt. Impressive. Served without head and very finely at Open Baladin. Huge fig aroma. Reminds one of a well made Oloroso. Wow.
Ruby with no head. Fruity and spicy tones. Malt, fruit, vine and spices. Full body with a sour finish.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2013 Thanks a lot for the share. 375ml bottle sampled. 2006 Vintage as "Baladin Xyauyu Birra Da Divano Riserva Teo Musso". Pours dark amber sherry with absolutely zero head. Nose is pure oxidation in best way imaginable. Lots of walnuts, sherry, sweet herbs, caramel, hazlenut, sweet brown sugar warming, but no alcohol noticable. Taste is pure oxidation, sweet caramel malts, heavy on walnuts, sherry, dark oak, slight warming booze as in fine liquor coupled with a sweetness,sirrup. This really reminds me of the early 1980s Oerbier Magnum Ive tried. This really shows oxidation at its best in beer. Quite impressive body substantial, but not overly heavy considering ABV. Zero carb, whilst warming the alcohol is completely masked.

-2009- Oklar röd-brun och naturligtvis utan skum. Doft: Alkohol, ek lagring, körsbär, wiskey, gröna äpplen, päron, hallon-björnbärs sylt, ananas. UPDATED: JUN 27, 2013 Very special beer. No carbonation. The aroma contains caramel, raisins, cognac and honey. The taste is similar. A little sweet. A little warming alcohol in the finish. A master piece! Mead like. Cognac like.

Bottle (50 cl), courtesy of I forgot who. Clear copper, no head. Fruity, nutty, caramelly with some floral hops. Full bodied, low carbonation. Semi sweet, medium bitterness. Good, but nothing special.

Bottle from SB. Seems like some people have accidentally rated the Xyauyù Barrel instead of this one, but from the text its clear this is the one that we got. 2009 vintage. You know it will taste sweet the second you smell it... Taste is very sweet, surprisingly un-boozy. Lots of dried fruit, sugar. The flatness of the carbonation strikes you - its not there at all! Finish is long, lightly boozy and sweet. Realizing I just poured a 50 cl bottle to myself, Im thinking this might be too much, but hey, Im celebrating a great day, so whatever...

Poured turbid rusty brownish mahogany color with no head or carbonation.  The nose is intense; a medley of plummy dark fruits, maple syrup, oaky bourbon, cherry. An excellent well balanced barley wine, the alcohol is expertly integrated for a 13.5% beer!

text:
Bottle.
Pours heavy dark amber without any head.
Heavy sweet, mead like brew. Taste of honney, plums and other dried fruits.

Bottle (2004). Pours a elegant redbrown color with no head (looks potent).  Sweet, honey-like, aroma with notes of flowers and chocolate. Taste has got the same kind of sweetness. It also has a delicious earthy, strawberry seeds kind of note. Aftertaste reminds me of a liquor filled chocolate bonbon. Incredible smooth mouthfeel. Full bodied. Very similar to a sweet polish mead actually.

Bottle...  Poured deep, ruby-red with zero head (naturally).  Nose had lots of rum and other spirits.  Tasted like how you would imagine a rum aged barleywine to taste.  Although it gave off quite the vinous character yielding a fortified wine-like note.  Warming booze, dark fruits like figs, dates, grapes alongside rum and wood and malt sweetness.

Bottled 0,50L. Dark brown color, much carghed with a medium foamy head resistance. Very complex nose, notes of roast cask, resin, caramel, hop and liquor Marsala. Powerfull and overpowering acoholic body, much smooth, mellow, fraught and candy. Realy exaggerated for my mouth.
Stupenda! Devo ringraziare il mio amico Roberto di Astral beers a Bolgna che me lha fatta assaggiare!
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. The smell is alcohol, toffee, candy, sweet, and malts.  The look is amber in color, no head, legs. The taste is sweet, alcohol, toffee, wood, and oxidation, but good.

Un viaggio davvero incredibile, ricorda un passito ma più delicato. Al naso è particolarissima, di una complessità unica, fatico a descriverla sinceramente. Al palato pulisce tantissimo, non invadente ma dal carattere davvero forte. Una birra con i controcoglioni, la migliore bevuta sinora
Corked 750 shared by Marcus. Pours clear brown with no head. Aroma is oaky and vinous. Full bodied. Flavor is vinous, wood and smooth brown sugar. A beautiful sipper. Finishing sweet. Nice.

Bottle from Healthy Spirits. Pours clear orange brown with no head and a strong vanilla and oak aroma. There is a very sweet thick molasses flavor with a slightly bitter finish and a warm alcohol trail. Very dilicious.

In bottle, thanks Craig. Pours a beautiful ruby colour with no head. Aroma of raisins, Christmas cake, alcohol, coconut, chocolate and caramel. Similar flavours with mild carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Alcohol is quite prominent with lingering coconut, honey and alcohol again. Lovely. I prefer this to the silver label. A little sweet to finish.

0,5 l wine corked, waxed top bottle kindly shared by Sigmund. Label reads: "Baladin Xyauyu Birra Da Divano Riserva Teo Musso 2008". Clear copper orange body. No head. Earthy, dried fruits, sharp herbal notes and wood on the nose. Full bodied. Thick oily texture. Flat. Alco warm. Heavy rock sugar sweet, dried fruits and a hint of coconut. Quite enjoyable.

Shared bottle at Sigmunds place, bottle no 263926. ABV 14,5 %.Pours clear amber with no head at all. Aroma is malty with wood and Madeira notes. Taste is medium sweet, thick oily mouthfeel, brown sugar,alcohol,vinous, dark dried fruits,flat carbonated, lingering herbal sweetness, a threat this one.

Shared 500 ml corked bottle, as Baladin Xyauyu Birra Da Divano Riserva Teo Musso 2008, imported to Germany by BraufactuM. Bought at Citti-Markt Flensburg. Orginal bottle No. 263926. German bottle No. 316. ABV is 14.5%. Clear reddish brown colour. No head nor carbonation. Strong vinous aroma, notes of old sherry / madeira, oak and dark dried fruits. Strong sweet flavour, in a blind test I might mistake it for an old sweet sherry or madeira. Notes of dark dried fruits again. A real treat if you want to satisfy your sweet tooth.

Bottle 500ml vintage 2008 @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours clear amber with no head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, alcohol, honey, oak, oxidization and dried fruits. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter with a long sweet and oak finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat.

500 ml bottle @ Patricks.  Clear amber body with just a quick fading hint of a head. Looks great anyway. Strong aroma of dry fruit, sweet malt, warming alcohol and caramel. Flavor is sweet malt syrup, dry fruit, caramel, brown sugar and warming alcohol. Fine body with a long and  sweet aftertaste. Another fantastic brew from Le Baladin.

8cl from a large bottle at Gaasa. Pours amber with no head. Heavy caramel aroma with lots of sugar and dark dried fruits. Very sweet and tastes more like liqueur than beer. Still its quite nice. 8cl was enough, but it was quite nice. Dessert beer! (2012-08-03)

Bottle at Patricks. Red brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma is sugar, alcohol, malt, spices, raisin, honey. Flavour  is sugar alcohol, malt, spices, raisin, oxidation. Full body. Very nice beer.

Bottle, at Patricks. More or less clear in the glass, amber in color, and quite flat. Very mead like aroma, with honey and some oxidation. Dried fruits, casked spirits, sweetness and some vanilla notes. The flavor goes in the same direction, its really vinous and tasteful. Lasting finish. Full body, almost sticky, pleasantly low on carbonation. 120614

Bottle. Pours deep amber with a tiny off-white head. Aroma of malt,caramel, alcohol and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, brown sugar, oak and raisins. Full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle sample at Beer Enthusiast release tasting. The beer has no head (!), and has a clear dark amber colour. Based on the aroma, this could almost have been a liqueur with a touch of sweet berries, leather, dried fruit, marzipan, cognac and alcohol. Tasted mead recently on another occasion, and this reminds me really about it. Pretty sweet flavour that is full of caramel, liqueur tones, and a little vanlije. A sticky and silky mouth feel. This is a real beer for dessert, either to (a Crème Brûlée perhaps) or as a dessert in itself!

Sampled from 0.5l bottle @ Beer Enthusiast release party. This is a lovely looking glowing cognac/sherry-colored beer that has basically no head. The aroma is definitely present, and its really something! Fantastic sherry-sweet and really vinious with lots of dried red fruits, figs, roses, wood, gamy tones, honey, sweet tomatoes and it feels really really complex and delicious. I dare to say that it has no carbonation and it feels like this really thick, sticky and liquid honey-like thing in the mouth. When tasting it my taste buds almost goes bananas! Lots and lots of sweet sticky oxidized caramel, warming alcohol, its really vinious and vanilla-woody with dried fruits, fresh figs and dates. Amazing sweet flavors! Will definitely have this again (if I can get it) 23.04.2012

Bottle sample @ Beer Enthusiast Release Tasting, Bergen. 2008 edition. The finisher for the evening, and doubtlessly the most anticipated (at least on my behalf). Pours a dark cognac body, with no head to be seen. Not so strange, perhaps, since this has been allowed to oxidize to a large extent even before bottling. Nose has intense port wine notes with loads of dark, dried fruits, cognac, wood, hints of caramel and the classic caramelized Norwegian bread spread "brunost" ("brown cheese"). Taste holds lots of caramelized brown sugar, molasses, vanilla, wood, hints of bitter grass and the "brunost" again. Intense. The vanilla re-surfaces with some dark sugary notes in the aftertaste, which is long and borderline sticky. This is more a dessert than a dessert wine substitute, but I quite like it. Original, intense and very, very sweet. Looking forward to more from Le Baladin for sure. :-)

Delicately served in a snifter glass, 100ml from tap at Open Baladin. Clear golden brown coloured body. Naked on the surface. Dark and dried fruity smell with fresh apricot notes coming through. Comprehensive taste profile including hints of dark vanilla, almond, caramel and prunes. Herbal dryness to the ending alongside warming alcohol and dark malty bitterness. Sherry-like texture. A sipper par excellence (Roma, 31.03.2012).
Cosa puoi aspettarti da una birra del genere? Quantomeno di rimanere sorpreso nello scoprire quanto sia piccola la distanza che la separa da vino. Questa birra da divano non si dimentica facilmente.

500ml. 2006 vintage. 13%. Pours a darker orange which can look more amber or ruby in different lighting. Flat of course; I wasnt expecting any carbonation after having the Silver and Copper labels recently. I like the aroma on this one the best; when I pulled the cork out, a pleasant banana aroma filled the immediate vicinity. Now in the snifter Im getting some nice caramel/toffee, molasses, honey, sweet malt, a little alcohol but not "boozy" per se. Yum, the flavor in this one is easily the best of the series: Quite fruity with again the sweet glaze/syrupy flavors. Kind of like a brandy, kind of like a port. Definitely a fermented winegrape element is present in the flavor. Its very  sweet, but manages to stay just under the cloying threshold. Mouthfeel is oily, medium viscosity, sticky finish; again, just like a port. I definitely like this one the best out of the series. I think this is mostly because this one helped me understand and appreciate what this series is supposed to be (and be about). I mean this is literally a "barley wine". That is, this is wine, not beer. Wine that happens to be fermented from grain instead of grapes. When I look at it in the context of wine, and through a filter of Italiana, I can really start appreciating this and liking it a lot. But yes, in that context; not in the traditional beer context would I easily understand this opus. Overall, very good to excellent.

Gold version. Vintage 2005. Serving date 2009-02-14.

500 ml sturdy bottle. Comes with a small leaflet with some short notes of which I can only understand fragments. Sealed with a regular wine cork. I couldnt find any freshness date on the bottle.

The cork comes off with a minimal pop, indicating low levels of carbonation. The cork really smells more of wine than beer. When poured, the beer has a very nice, glowing amber color with red hues, and is a bit hazy as a result of big amounts of very small, almost microscopic, floaties. The first pour results in a minimal amount of bubbles on top of the liquid, around the edges of the glass. However, this is no head, not even foam-like. Rather, its the kind of bubbles you sometimes get from pouring fruit juice or some wines. The second pour creates no bubbles at all. Actually, I didnt get the beer to produce any bubbles, no matter how hard I swirled my glass. However, when its swirled it clings onto the glass like a cognac or a wine - a great visual quality.

An intense smell of sweet fruits, raisins, and caramel hits the noose, accompanied by a sharp alcoholic twang. Notes of wood (perhaps oak) are there as well. The smell of this one is really heavy, dense and sweet. Its actually more reminiscent of a strong dessert wine, like sherry or port, than beer.

Lots of sweetness in the mouth: Fruits, mostly overripe plums, raisins, molasses and perhaps some brown sugar and honey-like sweetness as well. Theres is also a flavor I have a hard time identifying; the best I can do is describing it as a general candy-like flavor. These massive sweet flavors are balanced by some spices, oak and a more nutty earth flavor. The alcohol is rather prominent and provides a pleasant warmth. In the finish theres more sweet fruits and raisins, but also a gentle but distinct bitterness. Hot alcohol finishes things off. All in all, this one is very reminiscent of a sherry or a port, with big and bold strong vinous flavors, but there is still something about it that is characteristically beer-like.

It has basically no carbonation, and thus its really smooth. Medium body, very viscous and slightly chewy.

This one really pushes the boundaries for beer, and for what beer can be, almost transcending them occupying parts of the realm previously solely reserved for strong and sweet fortified wines. And I would say it could go head to head with any high quality dessert wine - and come out on top - when it comes to food pairings most often associated with sherry, port wines or Madeira - or as an aperitif for that matter. Although, I constantly compare this with wine and use wine as a measure to describe it, I must say its still a beer with some characteristics you probably wouldnt find in a wine. But considering how far away this is from your average ale, or barleywine for that matter, I dont think I can see my self being in the mood for this one that often. I guess its for that "special occasion" or when youre in the mood for something out of the ordinary, and in small amounts (I tried about 2/3 of a bottle and that was a bit much I think)
